page.title: 14Education in Dean
page.content: There are 2 schools in Dean. Eileen Wade is a state run Lower School which admits children full time at the beginning of the term in which they are 5 and mornings only the term before that. The children leave at the end of the year they are to go to Margaret Beaufort School in Riseley. Eileen Wade belonged to one of the main families in the village and gave money for the school to be built 10 years ago. The school survived closure 3 years ago and the numbers have now increased to 33 children from a low of 14. There is 1 full time and 1 part time teacher. Dean Grange School is a fee paying school which changed ownership and now has a new administrator. It appears that the numbers will now increase from the 40 this year. There are many pupils boarding from overseas.
